physical_appearance:This is a porcelain coffee pot. It is octagonal in shape
 with a tapered body
 curved handle
 and domed cover. It is painted with multicolored enamels in the form of repeating flower motifs. The pot is fitted with gold mounts
 and sits on a four legged gold base. The tap and the tripod base are in the shape of dolphins
 while the top of the pot is shaped as a horse.

sgcool_label_text:This coffee pot has been decorated with European made gilded mounts. Japanese ceramics
 such as Imari wares
 were mainly introduced to Europe in the latter part of the 17th century through the trades of the Dutch East India Company. Imari porcelain was made in Arita
 and is named after the port from which they are exported
 and are known for their underglaze blue
 iron-red and gold colours. Coffee became popular in Europe around the mid-17th century which increased the demand for coffee-specific wares.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This coffee pot has been decorated with European made gilded mounts. Japanese ceramics, such as Imari wares, were mainly introduced to Europe in the latter part of the 17th century through the trades of the Dutch East India Company. Imari porcelain was made in Arita, and is named after the port from which they are exported, and are known for their underglaze blue, iron-red and gold colours. Coffee became popular in Europe around the mid-17th century which increased the demand for coffee-specific wares.
